home.welcomeText: Plan your production here. Start with 'Simulation via XML File' to upload the latest information. You can then define your production program based on the forecasts. After that, you can see the proposed order and production programs in the 'Simulation' tab.

fileupload.title: Upload File for Simulation
fileupload.chooseResult: Select your result list from the previous period here. Please note that the upload may take a few seconds. Upon successful upload, you will be redirected to the simulation.

simulation.productionPlanning: Production Planning for the Next 4 Periods
simulation.errorMissingInput: Please make sure your input contains only numbers and is not empty.
simulation.inputInvalid: Please enter a number and do not leave the fields empty.
simulation.selectSplit: Select whether to split production orders.
simulation.tooltipProductionPlanning:
Plan your production for the next period here.
The predefined values are based on the given forecasts.
Please enter only numbers and do not leave the fields empty.
Splitting means dividing production orders to potentially optimize the production program.
simulation.tooltipProductionProgram: Here you can view the calculated production program. Please enter only numbers and do not leave the fields empty.
simulation.tooltipDeliveryProgram: Here you can view the calculated order program. Please enter only numbers and do not leave the fields empty.
simulation.tooltipWorkhours: Here you can view the calculated multiple shifts and overtime. Please enter only numbers and do not leave the fields empty.
simulation.tooltipOverview: Here you can view the complete planning for the upcoming period. Press 'Finish' to generate a file with the planning.
simulation.tooltipDirectSelling: Here you can plan your direct sales. Please enter only numbers as values.
simulation.inventoryOverview: Inventory Overview at the End of Periods
simulation.tooltipPartList: Overview of the bill of materials, i.e., which part is needed for which product. Here you can set the safety stocks for each part.

workhoursInfo.info2: A normal work week (8-hour shift per day) consists of 40 hours or 2400 minutes per week.
workhoursInfo.info3: If there is a surplus of up to 800 minutes (a total of up to 3200 minutes), overtime is ordered. This is divided by the 5 working days of the week.
workhoursInfo.info4: If there is a demand of more than 3200 minutes, a second shift is ordered, and for demand exceeding 4800+800=5600 minutes, a third shift is ordered.
workhoursInfo.info5: Example: With a demand of 3000 minutes, it results in 1 shift and 600/5 = 120 minutes of overtime per day.

toast.infoSplitItem: A product to be produced has been split. You can find it at the end of the production list.
toast.infoStartCalculation: Your production plan is being calculated. This may take a moment.
toast.successPeriodCalculation: Your production plan has been calculated. You will be redirected.
toast.successFileUpload: The file has been uploaded successfully. The latest data will now be used as the basis for period planning.
toast.errorFileUpload: Something went wrong. Please try again with a different file or contact an administrator.
toast.generateXML: Generating XML file of your planned values
toast.errorInvalidInputOvertimeExceed: Please do not exceed the value of 241 minutes of overtime.
toast.errorInvalidInputShiftOvertime: No overtime can be ordered with three shifts.
toast.errorNotDivisibleBy10: The number has to be divided by 10.
